column2: quī nōn abīvit in consiliō impiōrum
column3: et in viā peccātōrum nōn stetit
column4: et in catēdrā pestilentiae nōn sēdit
column5: ^ Blessed is the man who hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly
column6: nor stood in the way of sinners
column7: nor sat in the chair of pestilence

column1: 2 ^ sed in lēge Dominī voluntās ejus
column2: et in lēge ejus meditābitur diē ac nocte. ^ but his will is in the law of the Lord
column3: and on his law he shall meditate day and night.

column1: 3 ^ Et erit tamquam lignum quod plantātum est secus dēcursūs aquārum
column2: quod fructum suum dabit in tempore suō
column3: et folium ejus nōn dēfluet. Et omnia quaecumque faciet prōsperābuntur. ^ And he shall be like a tree which is planted near the running waters
column4: which shall bring forth its fruit in due season
column5: and his leaf shall not fall off. And all whatsoever he shall do shall prosper.

column3: quem prōjicit ventus ā faciē terrae. ^ Not so the wicked
column4: not so; but like the dust
column5: which the wind driveth from the face of the earth.

column1: 5 ^ Idiō nōn resurgent impiī in jūdiciō
column2: neque peccātōrēs in conciliō jūstōrum; ^ Therefore the wicked shall not rise again in judgment
column3: nor sinners in the council of the just;

column2: et iter impiōrum perībit. ^ for the Lord knoweth the way of the just
column3: and the way of the wicked shall perish.
